newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan forgoes purchases of wheat, barley at tender.
newsitem.headline: Japan forgoes purchases of wheat, barley at tender.

text.p: Japan's Food Agency said on Thursday it had decided to forego buying wheat and barley at its import tender on Thursday.
It was planning to buy 20,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat, 40,000 tonnes of Canadian wheat, 40,000 tonnes of Australian wheat and 30,000 tonnes of Australian feed barley at the weekly tender.

The yen's steep fall against the dollar pushed up prices, and the agency decided to seek the supplies at next week's import tender in the hope that prices would be weaker, a Food Agency official said.

The dollar climbed above 115 yen on Thursday, compared with the Wednesday U.S. level of 111.29, due to a comment by a senior Finance Ministry official that Japan's trade surplus will not be a major issue at the Group of Seven nations' meeting in Denver.
